Reviews.Title: “Poor, very poor”
Reviews.Author: El_Baggira
Reviews.Content: I do not know who wrote these feedbacks because they either they did not see anything better than it or the hoteliers wrote these feedbacks themselves. For start I booked twin room en-suit a few weeks in advance. I know that area a little bit and all “hotels” there are the same. Then I called them and booked the room I was surprised because they charged me £60 pn however their website said £50 (I checked their website today and the prices were adjusted recently – now it’s £65 pn twin room en-suit.) When we arrived (Joyce knew we would arrive something around 13:00) the room was not ready for us and we have been told the room would be ready by 14:15. Ok, we had to go around the area wasting time away however we travelled from Cornwall by a coach for 8:45 hours. We were exhausted. We were desperate to have a rest. We came back at 14:16 and … the room was not ready yet. So we had to go outside for wondering around. Fortunately we were allowed to leave our luggage in the room, so our wondering around was a little bit easier. About 3pm we managed to get in the room. The room was for three people – one single bed and one double, however I booked twin room. The room is so tiny – no chance to open the door without moving a suitcase. The bathroom is tiny maybe not bigger then 2,5 sq.m. The bathroom door had the lock which was broken inside, therefore you can’t lock the door from outside and if you do you can’t release yourself and need the help of the person who is in the room at this moment. The shower curtain is dirty down the bottom. The shower itself is covered with lime scale. The sink is straight in front of the face of the person who is engaged the single bed, so when you wash your face and brush your teeth the splashing reaches the single bed and the person’s face. The TV – in fact there is not TV as such because the room is maintained with the analogy TV which is out of date and as the result you can watch only 5 channels with showing pictures. As far as I know the TVs should be replaced for a digital reception and it was imposed on all hoteliers if they are big or small. We booked the English breakfast which contained one fried egg, two slices of bacon (bacon was over cooked and it was more like crisp with bacon flavour rather than a cooked bacon). http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Full_breakfast#Full_English_breakfast In fact it was only partially English breakfast. Toasts were ok. On the second day the marmalade tub has been served unsealed and it has been used before it reached our room. Additionally the next door guests were very noisy and disturbed all guests around. When I made a gentile complaint to Joyce she replied they were people with children. I do not care they were with or without children! The public order is applicable to everyone – with or without children. Due to behaviour of the next door guests my friend could not fall asleep for half of the night as her bed was next to the wall which divided our room with their one. No Internet is available.

Reviews.Title: “It's very Victorian”
Reviews.Author: Vkie
Reviews.Content: I thought this was all right for the price we paid. Actually no. It exceeded our expectation. For the price we paid, we are in Central London and tube access is just around the corner which is less than 5 minutes walk. We were served breakfast to our room at a requested time. The staff especially Joyce is very pleasant and kind enough to accommodate to our demand. We even left our luggage at the safe hand even after we checked out. Cause we still wanna do a lil bit of small trips around London before heading off to Heathrow. We requested early check-in and later check-out prior to that too. I know we are demanding but she made it. This hotel is very accommodative and that is something I like about it. The ensuite room is adequate. The bed is to our comfort. Yes the decoration might be a lil bit outdated but it's still fine. I actually thought it kinda define a lil bit of Victorian, which is incredible. Me and friend had an amazing stay. Thank you Joyce and Limegrove Hotel! Much Love, Malaysian Vickie

Reviews.Title: “perfect budget accomodation”
Reviews.Author: kaykev08
Reviews.Content: we stayed here in Late november 2009 for 2 nights and were pleasantly suprised, we arrived very early after an early arrival with our flight, but the staff were happy to look after our bags till the correct check in time, they tried to see if the current guest had vacated, but as they hadnt they happily secured our bags for us, when we returned from sight seeing Buckingham palace just round the corner, we were suprised by the room, we read bad reviews but were suprised about how completely adequate the room was, we had our own ensuite and as we were travelling with our teenage daughter we were happy about the amount of room we did have. The fact that when you are a tourist in a place you tend to be out most of the time sightseeing, so are only in your room for a minimal time to sleep and change your clothes, so this place is very good. The breakfast was satisfactory and for the price of the accomodation i was suprised that we were getting a cooked breakfast in australia for the same cost of lodgings you dont get a cooked breakfast included unless you pay extra , you only get toast and cereal with tea or coffee, so hot bacon and eggs was a welcome treat, as i was suffering jet lag i only had my husband and daughters reccomendation on the breakfast, which were high accolades. we liked the place so much we have decided to stay there again when we return to the uk in october 2011, this time we will stay for a week, and we are happy with the service we got last time we are happy to return again and again. well done I have already recommended this place to friends who prefer budget holidays.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location and value for money with an excellent, friendlier and prompt service”
Reviews.Author: Sam_Eddie
Reviews.Content: I travelled to London with my family (wife + 3 young kids at the ages 7, 8 & 10) during 4th to 11th June 2010 and opted to stay in this hotel only due to its close proximity to the Victoria stations (coach, rail & underground). It was only about 100-200 meters away from all these stations. However, with the amazing hospitality and friendlier service of the manageress Joyce & her staff gave us a feeling that we got much more than what we expected. On the first night (on the day we arrived) we were given two rooms since the only family room they had at the time was not vacant. It was a little hassle for us to use sharing toilets as we had to attend children as and when they wanted to use toilets. But since the second night we got the family room with attached bathroom which was very convenient and also with privacy. So, if I booked earlier it would be much better. The breakfast was served exactly on time at the time we requested; Continental and/or English breakfast as we ordered in the day before. Towels, bed linen were changed daily. I assume that the room service was exceeded requirement of a B&B hotel. The room was facing the Warwick way but noise was not disturbing us as the road was not much busy in the night. Carrying suitcases in the narrow stairway was difficult. The Joyce’s staff was kind enoug to offer their help as they can. Thanks girls. Since our return flight was in the evening, we were allowed keep our baggage (after checking out) in a safe chamber at the basement, free of charge. Thanks Joyce.

Reviews.Title: “What a mess you made about this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mirchebg
Reviews.Content: I spend few days in Lime Grove Hotel few years ago, and that's the reason I was shocked when I read reviews about it, and saw some pictures here. Then I try to find a hotel with the similar name in London, and gues what: all those people (25 od them) talking about Limegrove hotel in Victoria (101 Warwick Way London SW1V1QL) and not even one (exept me) about Lime Grove Hotel (32 Lime Grove, London W12 8EA) which adress is shown beneath the headline... Even the manager of Victoria LG Hotel was fooled by this reviews, and made answer to one of the guests comments. Now, back to the appropriate Lime Grove Hotel. It's a very quiet, not big bed and breakfast place, with small restaurant on ground level. Hotel is located in West London, near famous Shepard Bush, and just one minute walk from nearest underground station. My room was big enough, with huge and very good bed. Bathroom was almost perfect, big and very clean.

Reviews.Title: “should be reported!! very dangerous pplace to stay..needs to be checked by officals”
Reviews.Author: skinheadgirl69
Reviews.Content: this place for 70 pound a night was awful.we stayed 2 nights..couldnt afford to go else where...breakfast came to your room very poor and cold.the room was filthy,holes in the wall,wires near the sink,fag burns on ceiling,quilt cover,electric switch was still intacked so had they converted a kitchen into a room?fire extinguisher holding the doors open,bags of cement on the landing,smelly it was like a b and b for builders working away from home!!not for people wanting a nice break.the patio doors locked so couldnt open them..no key either for the doors,noisey on a morning of a pipe been tapped to wake us up early on a morning...shower need updating,as well as the shower curtain.WOULD RECOMEND YOU DONT STAY HERE...IT NEEDS A INSPECTOR TO CHECK OUT THE PLACE AND THE STAFF TO MAKE SURE THEY HAVE VISAS TO WORK IN ENGLAND...VERY DISSAPPOINTED!!!!!! YOUVE BEEN WARNED DO NOT STOP HERE!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Inexpensive, friendly, and great location.”
Reviews.Author: bezvadu
Reviews.Content: If you want a budget stay in London, you could do much worse than the Limegrove. We're from Latvia so are used to basic accomodation. If you keep your expectations in line, you'll find that Joyce is a cheerful hostess, you are close to everything, and the neighborhood is wonderful. I'd do it again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic value in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Bennploud
Reviews.Content: I stay in this hotel regularly as I work in London once a month, travelling from Canada. It is truly a home from home - the rooms are very clean and the breakfast is great. I can walk to almost anywhere in the capital and the owners are very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “OK BUDGET HOTEL â™¥”
Reviews.Author: nattynoo22
Reviews.Content: After reading a couple of reviews of this place i too was aprhensive, i was low on money and want a cheap getaway for a weekend. the hotel looked nice on the outside although a bit dated inside and in desprate need of a refurb. we were in room 7 which was an on suite room. there was a funny smell which came from the sink however walking round london it smelt like a drainage problem and not a limegrove one. the room was small but clean and more tha adequate to rest our heads for the night. the bathroom is a bit small and if your on the weighty side even over a 12 its a struggle gettin through the bathroom door as its half the size of a normal door lol, it was a bit noisey from people coming and going, plus there was a comunal toilet across from our door which made it extra busy. the breakfast was poor, 1 rasher of bacon and an egg and powdered milk to go with the tea! although the toast was nice. the location was fantastci to access most of the attractions of london as they are within walking distance of everywhere. only met the owners once that was on check in but they seemed really nice, the cleaners always seemed to be cleaning and we got fresh towels everyday.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel in UK”
Reviews.Author: RATHOLE
Reviews.Content: Worst B&B in UK by a country mile. From outside looks nice but once through the door when someone eventually opens it the truth hits home the place is disgusting! We were shown to a room and the double divan had no top sheet so you could see the baseunit it looked like the owner had found it in a skip it was filty,stained and made you feel like you would be bitten if you sat on it. The Tv in the room was also filty with half the buttons missing and Im sure no PAT certificate. The wiring in the building is dangerous and needs checking legally it should be checked every 12 mths.( I am a qualified Electrician) The fire brigade is my next email. Then you get to the toilet ( if you are eating stop reading now) the toilet had caked on (--) stains all over it and the window was held together by tape. We asked to speak to the manager about a refund but were told he wasnt home till 17.00 and we were told that we could not have a refund because we neede to give 24hrs notice so we after a long argument we said we would cancel the second night to are amazement the manager appeared and after a argument with him we got the second nights money refunded. The place is a hole, and i will do my upmost to have it shut down especially after the manager told My American partner she had no right to be in this country. We found three nice hotels on the block(The George, Jubilee House, Airways,) so don't think you are forced to stay here they were all cheaper too and clean. If they are full sleep in the Tower of London you will get treated better than here don't confuse this LIMEGROVE with the LIME GROVE two words which is by all accounts a very nice place.

Reviews.Title: “sufficient”
Reviews.Author: mouse176
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, pay attention not to leave anything unattended (i left for 2 minutes the mobile phone in the toilet and someone stole it). Nice breakfast, old furniture but it is very cheap and you get what you pay.The only problem is that if you need something you hardly find someone who can help you. I suggest the owner (i never seen her/him in 8 days) to be more visible

Reviews.Title: “Affordable hotel with nice and warm hosts”
Reviews.Author: colcem
Reviews.Content: I had a wonderful time here!! The manageress of this hotel, Mrs. Joyce and her family were very kindly and friendly for me. I was invited for a dinner with her and her and her husband. They even cooked me a very nice meal and we had a great time chatting. They were very friendly and the rooms were quite nice (with the price that we paid for in a hotel in London). It was thanks to their kindness that I had a happy memory in LONDON!! They have a great hospitality and warm heart. I recommend this hotel. The price is so reasonable. Colin ...

Reviews.Title: “I recommend Limegrove”
Reviews.Author: Jrup1
Reviews.Content: You definitely get what you pay for! You have to compare 'apples to apples': London is a very expensive city (I live in Manhattan, so I am used to pricy places). I stayed during a holiday week (into the New Year) and I was very pleased. Before checking into the Limegrove, Iâ€™ve visited a few places on that block - some were really disgusting (with ratings higher than Limegrove), shady owners and charged double. It's true, Limegrove is not a super new place (it can use some upgrades), but my room was clean, safe, big enough and warm (other hotels had no heat! charging 90GBP per night). Most importantly, Joyce & Nick (the owners) and Travis (their son) were soooo nice. I felt very comfortable in the place where the owners are present on a daily basis and practically pour their hearts and souls into the place. I will be back!

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for. Don't book cheap accomodation unless you can cope!”
Reviews.Author: cheddah22
Reviews.Content: You totally get what you pay for with this place. If you, like us, want a cheap place to stay in a key London location you cannot moan when you don't get the quality you'd expect from a more expensive place. My friends and I paid Â£49 for a triple room (cheaper than a youth hostel) so we expected poor service and a dirty room. Actually, it far exceeded our expectations. The room, ensuite (which we weren't expecting), bedding and towels were all very clean. The breakfast was a token gesture, but for the price of the room we could not complain. Before booking just take a moment to consider whether you want a cheap place to sleep, or whether you have unrealistic expectations. Seriously, if you're paying less than Â£20 pp for a night in Central London you HAVE to expect the worse and then, in the case of the Limegrove, you'll be pleasantly surprised. I'll definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “worst nightmare”
Reviews.Author: harry077
Reviews.Content: i booked this hotel for4 my wife my self and young child when we first arrived it looked nice from the outside and then the nightmare began we rang the bell i woman answered the horror began who are you we said we had a booking she asked if we had any proof we had a ref no. after a interagation she belived us then it was to the room up the dirty stairways up to the room once opended the doorwe all felt sick i wouldnt even put my dog in it it was your worst scene the sink was hanging off the wall the beds were filthy lukily no fleas on it we opende the bathroom door the handle fell off we had only been there 5 minsb we tried the tv she shoved a coat hanger in the back for a picture, we could not sleep in the room as it was so dirty the matreess sank in the end we slept on the floor as it were more comfy and no carpet .the morning came our english breakfast arrived one sausage one bacon one egg that was it. sterlised milk for the tea i threw up we left that day we had another two nights paid for would not reccomend for any human being or animal to stay there .

Reviews.Title: “Very nice B&B!!”
Reviews.Author: JAPAN-YUKI
Reviews.Content: I had a great time here!! The manajor of this hotel, Mrs. Joyce and her family were very kindly and friendly for me. I went to tea with her and She invited me to a music concert !! It was so nice time for me. My depature day, they took me to the airport in his car because the train stopped. It was thanks to their kindness that I had a happy memory in LONDON!! They have a great hospitality and warm heart. I recommend this hotel. The location is very good( very near VIctoria rail and coach station; about 6or7 min. walk) The price is so reasonable. The hotel staffs are very kindly. I want to stay here again !!

HotelInfo.Name: Limegrove Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 32 Lime Grove, London W12 8EA, England
